definition: to use it (or do it) for the purpose of (allaying hunger, relieving boredom etc) to some extent
to chat/to depend upon (literary)/temporarily/just/slightly
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
to find some consolation (idiom)/to find relief in
in order to minimally fulfill one's responsibilities/in order to get off the hook
to use it for the purpose of relieving the tedium to some extent

sentences.english: She diverted herself with talking to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 她和她婴儿说话聊以自娱。

sentences.english: I look at you and me and I smile.
sentences.chinese: 就要看你我在一起，只有微笑聊以蔚籍。

sentences.english: They create them personally for self-entertainment, or as presents for relatives.
sentences.chinese: 他们亲自奏刀创作，寄情写意，聊以自娱，馈赠亲友。

sentences.english: Most of the villagers survive off tiny plots of cropland.
sentences.chinese: 大多数村民靠小块农地产出聊以为生。

definition: to amuse oneself
(of a gift) to be a small token of one's feelings
temporarily/for the time being
to dispel anguish
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to encourage oneself
to divert oneself from melancholy
to spend one's leisure time/to idle away the time
to comfort/to console/to reassure
to compare oneself/to view oneself as
my clumsy writing (humble expr.)/my humble pen
to provide as expedient/to use temporarily as/to make shift
to eat one's fill
emotions expressed in writing
to dismiss with a sigh (idiom); a hopeless case
to dismiss with a sigh (idiom); a hopeless case
to thank with a gift
